introduction: 2 Lizards reflects the unfolding realities of the pandemic in real time. Using a combination of 3D animation and footage of New York City, each roughly three-minute episode illustrates the mundanities of quarantine life: rooftop hangouts, Zoom birthdays, the 7:00 p.m. clap for essential workers, the thrill of breaking social distance with a new lover. Barki and Bennani’s process was mostly inspired by their daily events and conversations with friends, whose viewpoints are included in the series through a cast of animated characters.更多详情：https://www.moma.org/magazine/articles/505
